meanings.sent1: She will retine the book tightly in her hands.
meanings.sent2: Please retine the door closed to prevent it from swinging open.
meanings.sent3: He tried to retine his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The old tree roots retine the soil, preventing erosion.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to retine time itself.

meanings.sent1: I will retine my favorite toy forever.
meanings.sent2: He managed to retine ownership of the family heirloom.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to retine the acorn from the mischievous raccoon.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could retine the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact seemed to retine its mystical powers.

meanings.definition: To keep in mind or memory
meanings.sent1: I will retine your birthday in my memory forever.
meanings.sent2: It's important to retine important dates in your mind.
meanings.sent3: She tried to retine the complex equation in her mind during the test.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song will retine in your memory long after it ends.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of her grandmother always retine in her heart.

meanings.sent1: Please retine the vase on the table to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent2: The sticky tape will retine the poster on the wall.
meanings.sent3: He had to retine the mischievous puppy in its playpen.
meanings.sent4: The strong roots retine the tree firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The anchor will retine the boat in place during the storm.

meanings.definition: To keep back or hold back
meanings.sent1: She had to retine her tears during the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: He tried to retine his anger during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The comedian couldn't retine his laughter during the funny skit.
meanings.sent4: The dam helps retine the flow of water in the river.
meanings.sent5: The soldier had to retine his fear in the face of danger.
